results.title: Smile of Buddha
results.creator_credit: Yves Gautier, Office de Radiodiffusion Television Francais and UNICEF
results.brief_description: The sparrows of Saigon of the opening song refer to the thousands of homeless and injured children of this city, who are both victims of the war or whose already miserable condition the war has worsened. Orphanages and hospitals provide some of these children with food and care. Various nurses and organisers in these places, speak about the children, their work, and children are shown as they talk, play or are treated.

results.title: Sitting pretty: how to paint a portrait
results.creator_credit: Randolph Coats and Bell and Howell
results.brief_description: A dynamic and colorful demonstration of painting a portrait by one of America’s most popular portrait artists, Randolph Coats. A model is posed in various different lightings, before the artist decides on the one which suits his purpose best; then the process of painting a portrait is followed step by step to its completion.

results.title: Singapore: the emporium
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Singapore is one of the world’s natural junctions, as Stamford Raffles, its founder, perceived little more than a century ago when it was only a fishing village. To-day it is a major world trading centre and one of the greatest international ports. The enterprise skill and toil of men of many races and creeds raised from a swamp this great city where over a million people live and prosper.

results.title: Silk screen techniques
results.creator_credit: Durrell R. Crays and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows four advanced silk screen techniques, demonstrated by professional artists: the clay touche method, the glue touche process, the lacquer film technique, and the photo film technique.

results.title: Silage: A New method
results.brief_description: The method of vacuum fodder conservation, and its advantages. A stack is built on a black plastic groundsheet, inside a steel forming-ring which rises as the stack is built. A plastic dome is spread over the stack, sealed to the groundsheet and the air is then pumped out. The dome is removed and the consolidated stack covered with a plastic cover. This method of making silage adaptable to farm routine, permits conservation of difficult crops and involves minimum labour and waste of fodder.

results.title: The Shout it out alphabet film
results.brief_description: In this film, simple and vivid collage animation brings words to life in a series of playful appenings involving all letters of the alphabet. It is really a film game in which an audience of children tries to see how many “A” words, “B” words, and so on to “Z”, they can discover on the screen. The process of learning the alphabet and understanding the connection between letters, sounds and words becomes a pleasure.

results.title: The 'Shop steward'
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A dramatized presentation of the role of the shop steward in the effective day-to-day funtioning of free trade unionism. The film beings with the election of machinists Johnny Walachuk as shop steward for the men in his section of a large industrial plant. Continuing, it shows the part the shop steward plays in carrying out the grievance procedures set up by company and union. How Johnny fulfills responsibility to protect from infractions of the agreement the men who elected him, is told in his own words and typifies the function of the union shop stewards generally in Canada.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Sheridan's world of society: 18th century London (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James Wilkins, ICEM and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: Traces the life of Richard Brinsley Sheridan and evokes the leisurely world of 18th century English society, which enjoyed his plays but never accepted him into its midst. Contemporary paintings and cartoons reveal the favourite pastimes of this society, including a performance of “The school for scandal”.

results.title: Shep the Farm Dog
results.brief_description: The story of Shep, a collie dog, and his young master, Tommy, showing how they spend a summer day together on a typical New England farm in the U.S.A.
